column4: network-manager currently configures my resolv.conf to use "nameserver 192.168.1.1"
4.2.2.2 - is level3's nameserver
i've tried 8.8.8.8 w/ the dig and it doesn't work
but  i can ping 8.8.8.8
just tried "dig @8.8.8.8 google.com" and it says: http://pastebin.org/82324
whereas "ping 8.8.8.8" produces: http://pastebin.org/82325
i just don't get it.....
i've tried that as well - the other weird thing, is that the tomato router gets DHCP ip from ISP - and it doesn't obtain any nameservers either
and when i tcpdump the interface - and do a dig - i don't see any traffic
IIRC dig uses tcp when you do the @
what does this do.. telnet 8.8.8.8 53
seems to connect fine
seems to connect - if i type anything - it just says Connection closed by foreign host.
what does this return: dig @8.8.4.4 google.com
http://pastebin.org/82328
perhaps they blocked yo
what does this report: dig @198.6.1.1 google.com
